channel.title: Which is it?
channel.description:
Recently I was reading up on the impeachment proceedings against Dick Cheney. For a different perspective I read a Fox News article. The last line, a quote from Bush's press secretary, stuck with me: http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,308738,00.html
"It is this behavior that leaves the American people shaking their head in wonder at this Congress," Perino said.
Hmmm. It is true that Congress has a lower approval rating than Bush. But...maybe, just maybe, people are pissed off because Bush and Cheney [b]haven't[/b] been impeached. Are people really pissed off at the Congress because they aren't bowing down to Bush enough? Or is it because anybody with even a marginal knowledge of US government knows that Congress can end the war anytime they want, even without a large majority?

item.title: Which is it?
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:

Recently I was reading up on the impeachment proceedings against Dick Cheney. For a different perspective I read a Fox News article. The last line, a quote from Bush’s press secretary, stuck with me:

http://www.foxnews.com/story/0,2933,308738,00.html

"It is this behavior that leaves the American people shaking their head in wonder at this Congress," Perino said.

Hmmm. It is true that Congress has a lower approval rating than Bush. But…maybe, just maybe, people are pissed off because Bush and Cheney haven’t been impeached. Are people really pissed off at the Congress because they aren’t bowing down to Bush enough?
